alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 1:05PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MASON... NORTHWESTERN LEWIS...SOUTHEASTERN BROWN...ADAMS AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 105 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sardinia to near Georgetown to near Aberdeen, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Hillsboro, Georgetown, Washington, Mount Orab, West Union, Manchester, Peebles, Ripley, Aberdeen, Winchester, Sardinia, Seaman, Belfast, New Market, Emerald, Decatur, Russellville, Mowrystown, and Dover. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
